--- title: "Travel time" format: html --- ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-6} **Name:** Travel time **Source:** [Weiss et al. (2018), Weiss et al. (2020), Ryan et al. (2025)](https://doi.org/10.1038/nature25181, https://doi.org/10.1038/s41591-020-1059-1, https://idem-lab.github.io/traveltime/) **Version:** software: 0.0.0.9000 **Keywords:** travel time, accessibility, cities **Type:** Raster **Description:** Travel time to nearest urban centre: Weiss et al. (2018) https://doi.org/10.1038/nature25181 Travel time to nearest health facility: Weiss et al. (2020)https://doi.org/10.1038/s41591-020-1059-1 Travel time to â€¦ anywhere. The R package [`traveltime`](https://idem-lab.github.io/traveltime/) enables a user to create a map of travel time over an area of interest from a user-specified set of geographic coordinates and friction surface. The package provides convenient access to global friction surfaces for walking and motorised travel for the year 2020. The final result is a raster of the area of interest where the value in each cell is the lowest travel time in minutes to any of the specified locations. **Units:** minutes **Available in geocoded GMD?** Yes **Available from Space2Stats?** Yes ::: ::: {.g-col-6} **Map** ::: {.cell} ::: **Coordinate reference system:** WGS84 (EPSG:4326) / defined by user inputs **Spatial coverage:** Global / defined by user inputs **Spatial resolution:** 30 arcsec (~ 1km) / defined by user inputs **Temporal coverage:** 2020 friction surface / defined by user inputs **Temporal resolution:** point in time of friction surface / defined by user inputs **License:** travel time data: CC BY 4.0 software: MIT license **Citation:** Ryan GE, Tierney N, Golding N and Weiss DJ. traveltime: an R package to calculate travel time across a landscape from user-specified locations. Gates Open Res 2025, 9:50 (https://doi.org/10.12688/gatesopenres.16356.1) D. J. Weiss, A. Nelson, C. A. Vargas-Ruiz, K. Gligoric, S., Bavadekar, E. Gabrilovich, A. Bertozzi-Villa, J. Rozier, H. S. Gibson, T., Shekel, C. Kamath, A. Lieber, K. Schulman, Y. Shao, V. Qarkaxhija, A. K. Nandi, S. H. Keddie, S. Rumisha, P. Amratia, R. Arambepola, E. G. Chestnutt, J. J. Millar, T. L. Symons, E. Cameron, K. E. Battle, S. Bhatt, and P. W. Gething. Global maps of travel time to healthcare facilities. (2020) Nature Medicine. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41591-020-1059-1 ::: ::: ::::::: grid ::: {.g-col-lg-8 .g-col-lg-offset-2 .g-col-md-10 .g-col-md-offset-1 .g-col-sm-12 .g-col-12} **Usage:** The R package implements methods from Weiss et al. 2018, 2020 to calculate travel time from given locations over a friction surface. Pre-prepared walking or motorised friction surfaces can be obtained with `get_friction_surface`. User can also provide their own friction surface. This surface but must be in resistance units (1/conductance), e.g. minutes/meter. See Van Etten 2017. **Limitations:** Over large areas this function can require significant RAM and will be slow. **Examples:** NA **Access:** Direct download travel time rasters from Malaria Atlas Project.R package: https://idem-lab.github.io/traveltime/ ::: panel-tabset ## R No code ## Output ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "None" ``` ::: ::: ::: **Last updated:** 10/17/25 ::: ::::::: ```{=html}
